Articles.Content:
Figure I'll leave this here

Highly kerbalized, just something fun I've been wanting to do.

Stand alone mod, no dependencies. Moves you places. Will have pretty particle effects.

Edited November 17, 2014 by RoverDude
Is it just an engine, or is it a self-sustaining KSPI warp drive?
It's a warp drive. Not a KSPI one
Is it bad that I already want this in a mod?

Is it bad that I already want this in a mod?

Sounds like good news to me

Figure it will be ready for prime time within a week.
Is there being no download link a sign that you intend to make this into part of some larger project?

Is there being no download link a sign that you intend to make this into part of some larger project?

It's a sign that there's nothing to download yet

I need this in my life. I need this so badly you have no idea. I've been wanting a standalone Warp Drive for ages.

Not one that I have to download with 50 other parts I'll probably not use, not one that uses weird resource systems and other wonky things, not a jump drive that's just a glorified Hyper Edit with pretty effects, just a warp drive that lets me fly at hilariously awesome and variable speeds in a straight line at multiples of the speed of light. Please, please give me this small wonder in my life. My kerbals will love you for it, and maybe hate me for it because of the inevitable explosions that will follow it its wake. XD
Looks nice!
looks good, i don't do mods but if i did this would be one of them
oh god Roverdude i think i got an aneurysm because of this overly awesome surpri88b gtr5ffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffnhjjuy777

2 things you could do....

1. add emissives for throttle

2. add a small trim around where the ring and engines intersect. this shouldn't be too hard, you just take a profile of the ring shape, give it some thickness.
So...how does it work? Balance, fuel/power requirements, speeds, etc.

I like this. It would be really cool if you could make a more realistic version, like Harold White's Alcubierre Drive.

It would also be really cool if it is in the staging menu, and throttle controls how fast it sends you.

"Caution: Contains Science"

This looks nice. How is it going to work?

2 things you could do....

1. add emissives for throttle

2. add a small trim around where the ring and engines intersect. this shouldn't be too hard, you just take a profile of the ring shape, give it some thickness.

Yep, there are throttle emmissives I hear ya about #2... was a pretty quick lazy afternoon model

So...how does it work? Balance, fuel/power requirements, speeds, etc.

Uses exotic matter generated slowly via an on-board reactor.

Balance is that this does location translation (like a 'real' Alcubierre drive), not acceleration. So you are going to have weird DV issues.

Also, shuts down if operated within a certain distance of a planet (going with 1,000,000 for the current SOI.

Also obliterates anything in front of it, so don't try to dock with the engine on

Speed is exponential and configurable.

I like this. It would be really cool if you could make a more realistic version, like Harold White's Alcubierre Drive.

It would also be really cool if it is in the staging menu, and throttle controls how fast it sends you.

Already been done on both counts. There's a very nice version of that warp drive already released. And I tie the throttle to how fast space is moved around you.

"Caution: Contains Science"

This looks nice. How is it going to work?

See above
Wow that looks awesome! Looking forward to seeing it in action!

Wow that looks awesome! Looking forward to seeing it in action!

Testing the plugin now... it's downright frightening because you get some visual effects similar to mach effects at a certain velocity...
Sounds great, looking forward to this!

Sounds great, looking forward to this!

Will be released this week. The core stuff works, I just want to add some negative effects, safety controls, and better effects.
Very nice drive, Rover. If you're not careful, you're cover all the ground that NFT *and* KSPI cover soon .

Very nice drive, Rover. If you're not careful, you're cover all the ground that NFT *and* KSPI cover soon .

You can do the NTR's and waste heat
Thank you so much! I really wish I could give you more rep for this! that model looks so awesome!

Not one that I have to download with 50 other parts I'll probably not use, not one that uses weird resource systems and other wonky things, not a jump drive that's just a glorified Hyper Edit with pretty effects, just a warp drive that lets me fly at hilariously awesome and variable speeds in a straight line at multiples of the speed of light. Please, please give me this small wonder in my life. My kerbals will love you for it, and maybe hate me for it because of the inevitable explosions that will follow it its wake. XD

What can't you do! Jeesh man! You are brilliant!
